subject: RE: [EVP-ITC] Re: Paranormal State!?
author: bruce halliday

LC,
 
We all know that most of the paranormal community, given the opportu=
nity would choose 
a cheesy tv sci fi ghostie show complete with mirrors, b=
ed sheets and scary sound effects.
over legitimate selfless paranormal rese=
arch purely for research's sake.
 
But if it were not for these type of sho=
ws what would all the self proclaimed psychic mediums
and paranormal expert=
s do? crossword puzzles. Don't you realise that it is shows like this and t=
aps that
have shown that anyone that can afford an emf detector, voice reco=
rder and camcorder with nightshot
and a brand new shinny silver case to car=
ry it all in, can start a paranormal investigating society and
pay their en=
try fee to get into places like eastern state penn. and collect "REAL" para=
normal evidence.
 
maybe we should try that and stop killing ourselves doin=
g real research and trying to gather legitimate evidence.
 
come on you guy=
's knew I had to throw my 2 cents in!
 
Bruce
 
 
Bruce Halliday 


To: EVP=
-ITC@yahoogroups.comFrom: lcdupla@...: Tue, 5 Feb 2008 17:49:14 +=
0000Subject: [EVP-ITC] Re: Paranormal State!?




I just got to add to FS' =
point with respect to Paranormal State. Anyone notice Ron Milione (TAPS gad=
get electronics expert) appeared on Paranormal State as now a "demon expert=
," identifying an EVP on the show as a "demon" by the sound of its voice on=
 the recording?Then I saw Ron on the History Channel's UFO Hunters as a UFO=
 researcher/expert. I'm trying to keep count, but that makes him a electron=
ics guru, UFO expert and demonologist! Nice guy, but I think he just has a =
great agent that can get him these "roles." Also, I saw a lady have her hom=
e investigated by the Penn State bunch on Paranormal State and supposedly i=
n need of their help, then I turn the channel and see her as a paranormal i=
nvestigator on Ghost Hunters International! She must have a great agent, to=
o. ;)LC --- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, Frank Sumption <purplealiengirl@...=
> wrote:>> > At the risk of being negative yet again, all I can say is --Yo=
u have got to be friggin' kidding!? No wonder all the 'serious researchers'=
 call it entertainment, cuz shows like that put this work back with Barnum =
and Baily! I think they take urban myths, like the haunted piano, and do a =
show on it, with all actors. Their demonolgist supposedly worked on the Ami=
tyville case, ya mean the Hollywood version, cuz the real case was nothin!?=
 Just watch the people involved, and you can tell they are actors, with spe=
ech training, not a single um, ah, or stutter ever uttered! It's all just t=
oo well rehearshed and scripted for me to watch any more of it. Some Googel=
e results for 'haunted piano'; http://paranormal.about.com/library/blstory_=
august04_17.htm 'YouTube - Haunted Piano Edited > > > > The classical versi=
on of the Haunted Piano is now renewed and better than ever! Again, It's a =
documentary about a haunted house and a piano that plays by ...www.youtube.=
com/watch?v=3DaBnOXfnR7WM - 73k - Cached - Similar pages' 'Ghosts - Superna=
tural Message Boards > Haunted Piano > > > > I have investigated a place a =
couple of years ago that had a haunted piano that had been in a fire. It wa=
s very interesting, the piano didn't sound right ...www.ghostvillage.com/gh=
ostcommunity/lofiversion/index.php/t8231.html - 15k - Cached - Similar page=
s' haunted piano - Truveo Video Search> > > > woke up nd sumone was lpayin =
mah piano but nobody was there.. i was so scared..www.truveo.com/haunted-pi=
ano/id/4113464547 - 97k - Cached -Similar pages> Haunted Piano - Ghosts - S=
upernatural Message Boards > > > Frank-S> _________________________________=
